citation.article-title: Vulcanisaeta distributa gen. nov., sp. nov., and Vulcanisaeta souniana sp. nov., novel hyperthermophilic, rod-shaped crenarchaeotes isolated from hot springs in Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Vulcanisaeta (Vul.ca.ni.sae´ta. L. adj. vulcanicus volcanic; L. n. saeta stiff hair; N.L. fem. n. Vulcanisaeta a rigid rod inhabiting volcanic hot springs)
Cells are rigid, straight to slightly curved rods that occasionally bend, branch out or bear spherical bodies at the terminals ('golf clubs').
Prefers extremely high temperature (85-90 °C) and weakly acidic conditions (pH 4.0-4.5) for growth.
Resistant to chloramphenicol, kanamycin, oleandomycin, streptomycin and vancomycin.
Sensitive to erythromycin, novobiocin and rifampicin.
Possesses cyclic and acyclic tetraether core lipids.
DNA G­C content ranges from 43.9 to 46.2 mol%.
The 16S rDNA is typical of a crenarchaeote in sequence signature analysis.
Phylogenetically, represents an independent lineage in the family Thermoproteaceae.
The type species is Vulcanisaeta distributa.
